intro: Thermopsis lanceolata var. mongolica, commonly known as Mongolian yellow gentian, is a perennial herb native to the steppes of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow flowers with five petals. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, temperate climates. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
